snippet: After a severe drought, the cost of the program has drawn renewed attention as the Obama administration and Congressional Republicans wrangle over ways to cut the deficit.
abstract: Drought of 2012, worst in 50 years, could leave taxpayers with a record bill of nearly $16 billion in crop insurance costs because of poor yields; issue has drawn renewed scrutiny as White House and Congress wrangle over ways to cut the deficit.
lead_paragraph: After a severe drought, the cost of the program has drawn renewed attention as the Obama administration and Congressional Republicans wrangle over ways to cut the deficit.

headline.seo: Record Taxpayer Cost Is Seen for Crop Insurance
headline.main: Record Taxpayer Cost Is Seen for Crop Insurance
headline.print_headline: Record Taxpayer Cost Is Seen for Crop Insurance
